description: As a curriculum developer, I want to understand farmers' technology access, skill levels, and availability, so that I can design training that meets their actual needs and constraints
tasks: Create survey questions (device access, tech experience, seasonal availability, learning preferences, accessibility needs)
Distribute survey to 5+ farmers or conduct proxy analysis with extension educators
Analyze responses and identify patterns (device types, skill levels, seasonal blackouts, anxiety indicators)
Document findings in curriculum/learner-profile.md
acceptance_criteria: Survey completed by 5+ farmers or proxy analysis completed
Learner profile includes technology access breakdown, skill level distribution, seasonal availability map

description: As a curriculum developer, I want to review existing GitHub training materials, so that I can identify gaps for agricultural audiences and reuse applicable content
tasks: Review GitHub Learning Pathways, Microsoft Learn GitHub modules, GitHub Skills
Review ../github repository documentation and templates
Analyze existing materials for agricultural relevance
Identify reusable resources (terminology, screenshots, exercise patterns)
Write curriculum/gap-analysis.md
acceptance_criteria: Gap analysis document created comparing existing materials to farmer needs

description: As a curriculum developer, I want to identify 10+ farming scenarios where GitHub solves real problems, so that I can make every training exercise relevant and practical
tasks: Brainstorm farm management challenges across categories (task tracking, record-keeping, coordination, compliance, equipment, livestock, scheduling)
Map GitHub features to farm scenarios (repos for field data, issues for repairs, projects for planting)
Document 10+ use cases with farm problem, GitHub feature, expected outcome, difficulty level
Validate use cases with agricultural extension expert if available
acceptance_criteria: Farm use case library includes 10+ scenarios
Each use case includes farm problem, GitHub feature, expected outcome, difficulty level
Use cases cover diverse farm types (crops, livestock, equipment, compliance)

description: As a curriculum developer, I want to publish planning documents so that the project has clear scope, timeline, and risk management
tasks: Review and finalize PROJECT-PLAN.md
Review and finalize JIRA-STRUCTURE.md
Review and finalize RISK-REGISTER.md
Review and finalize DEPENDENCY-ANALYSIS.md
Review and finalize RACI-CHART.md
Fix broken links to BEST-PRACTICES.md and _research/DOMAIN-RESEARCH.md
acceptance_criteria: All planning artifacts published to repository root
Planning artifacts include Mermaid diagrams, tables, and cross-links

story_title: Define Learning Objectives for All Sessions
description: As a curriculum developer, I want to write measurable learning objectives for each of 8-12 sessions, so that learners know what they'll achieve and I can assess skill acquisition
tasks: Map curriculum to Bloom's Taxonomy progression (Sessions 1-2: Remember/Understand; 3-6: Apply/Analyze; 7-12: Evaluate/Create)
Write 3-5 learning objectives per session using Bloom's action verbs
Ensure objectives are measurable via hands-on demonstrations
Validate progression: each session builds on previous skills
Write curriculum/learning-objectives.md
acceptance_criteria: Learning objectives document includes 3-5 objectives per session (24-60 total)
Objectives use Bloom's Taxonomy verbs appropriate to cognitive level
Progression validated: Session 1 is foundational, Session 12 requires cumulative skills

description: As a curriculum developer, I want a reusable session structure following Kolb's Experiential Learning Cycle, so that every session follows a consistent, research-backed format
tasks: Design template with Kolb's Cycle sections: Learning Objectives, Farm Context, Instructor Demo, Guided Practice, Concept Explanation, Independent Practice, Reflection, Application Assignment, Feedback Survey
Include timing for 2.5-hour sessions with breaks
Add accessibility features checklist
Include 'I do, we do, you do' facilitation script sections
Write curriculum/session-template.md
acceptance_criteria: Template includes all Kolb's Cycle stages

story_title: Plan Seasonal Scheduling with Blackout Periods
description: As a curriculum developer, I want to create a delivery calendar that avoids planting and harvest seasons, so that farmers can attend without conflicts
tasks: Define planting (May-June) and harvest (Sept-Oct) blackout periods
Design 3 training blocks: Block 1 (March-April), Block 2 (July-Aug), Block 3 (Nov-Dec)
Plan recap sessions after each seasonal gap
Plan asynchronous resources for gaps (videos, refresher one-pager, GitHub Discussions)
Write curriculum/seasonal-schedule.md
acceptance_criteria: Seasonal scheduling calendar created showing 3 blocks
Blackout periods documented; sessions scheduled around them

description: As a curriculum developer, I want a comprehensive checklist of WCAG 2.2 Level AA and Section 508 requirements, so that every material I create meets accessibility standards
tasks: Research WCAG 2.2 Level AA success criteria for training materials
Document Section 508 requirements by material type
Create checklist with 20+ checkpoints: Visual, Auditory, Navigation, Content, Structure
Identify testing tools: WAVE, axe DevTools, WebAIM Contrast Checker, NVDA/JAWS
Write curriculum/accessibility-checklist.md
acceptance_criteria: Checklist covers all material types (slides, videos, documents, exercises)

story_title: Develop Session 1 — Introduction to GitHub & Repositories
description: As a curriculum developer, I want to create Session 1 materials teaching farmers what GitHub is and how to navigate repositories, so that learners build foundational knowledge and confidence
tasks: Create 20-25 slide deck: What is GitHub? (farm analogies), Repository tour, navigating files, account creation
Develop hands-on lab: Explore sample farm repository (find planting schedule, read equipment log)
Write quick-reference guide: GitHub Terminology Cheat Sheet (15+ terms with farm analogies)
Create facilitation script with 'I do, we do, you do' progression and timing
Apply accessibility: alt text, high-contrast, 18pt+ fonts, keyboard navigation
acceptance_criteria: Slide deck follows session template structure
Lab exercise uses farming scenario from use case library
Facilitation script includes timing, talking points, troubleshooting
Materials pass accessibility checklist (alt text, contrast 4.5:1+, 18pt+ fonts)

story_title: Develop Session 2 — GitHub Issues for Task Tracking
description: As a curriculum developer, I want to teach farmers how to create, manage, and comment on Issues, so that they can use GitHub for farm task tracking
tasks: Create slide deck: What are Issues? Creating, labeling, assigning, commenting, closing
Develop hands-on lab: Create broken fence repair issue with photo, assign, comment, close
Write quick-reference guide: Issue Creation Step-by-Step with screenshots
Create facilitation script; apply accessibility features
acceptance_criteria: Slide deck uses farm examples (equipment repairs, livestock alerts, planting tasks)
Lab exercise includes photo upload tested across devices
Quick-reference guide includes screenshots with callouts

story_title: Develop Session 3 — GitHub Projects for Planning
description: As a curriculum developer, I want to teach farmers how to use GitHub Projects for farm planning, so that they can organize tasks visually and track progress
tasks: Create slide deck: What are Projects? Board vs Table vs Timeline, adding issues, organizing
Develop hands-on lab: Create spring planting project board with issues per field
Write quick-reference guide: Project Board Setup Checklist
Create facilitation script; apply accessibility features
acceptance_criteria: Slide deck demonstrates Board, Table, and Timeline views
Lab exercise produces functional project board
Quick-reference guide includes when to use each view type

description: As a curriculum developer, I want to test Session 1-3 materials with accessibility tools, so that I confirm WCAG 2.2 Level AA compliance
tasks: Run WAVE accessibility checker on slide decks (export as PDF)
Test with screen reader (NVDA or VoiceOver)
Check color contrast ratios (WebAIM, target 4.5:1+)
Test keyboard navigation for interactive elements
Review alt text quality and completeness
Write curriculum/accessibility-audit-sessions-1-3.md
acceptance_criteria: Accessibility audit report documents findings and fixes

description: As a curriculum developer, I want to test prototype materials with 1-2 farmers or agricultural educators, so that I validate approach and assess cognitive load
tasks: Recruit 1-2 pilot testers (farmers or extension educators)
Deliver Session 1 materials to testers
Collect feedback: clarity, pacing, relevance, overwhelming?
Observe cognitive load: concept struggles, too many terms?
Write curriculum/pilot-test-report.md with revision priority list
acceptance_criteria: Feedback collected via survey or interview
Cognitive load assessment documented (low/medium/high per session)
Revision list created with priority rankings

story_title: Iterate Session 1-3 Based on Pilot Feedback
description: As a curriculum developer, I want to revise prototype materials based on pilot testing findings, so that materials are refined before replicating to Sessions 4-12
tasks: Review pilot feedback and cognitive load observations
Revise slides to simplify complex sections
Adjust lab exercises (add scaffolding or stretch challenges)
Update facilitation scripts with troubleshooting notes
Re-run accessibility audit on revised materials
Update session template with lessons learned
acceptance_criteria: Revised materials re-tested if major changes
Session template updated with lessons learned
Final Session 1-3 materials ready for delivery

description: As a curriculum developer, I want a repeatable process for testing accessibility, so that every material is evaluated consistently
tasks: Document 6-step testing workflow: WAVE/axe, screen reader, contrast, captions, keyboard nav, log results
Create testing log template with columns: Material, Date, Tool, Pass/Fail, Issues, Remediation
List remediation resources (WCAG reference, alt text guide, caption tools)
Schedule testing checkpoints after each session development
acceptance_criteria: Testing log template ready for use
Workflow integrated into session development tasks

story_title: Implement Universal Design for Learning (UDL) Features
description: As a curriculum developer, I want to provide multiple means of representation, action, and engagement, so that learners with diverse needs can all succeed
tasks: Add visual + verbal + hands-on components to every session
Provide choice in practice scenarios (crops vs livestock vs equipment)
Design multi-method assessments (verbal, written, hands-on)
Create motivational 'Why this matters for YOUR farm' openings
Develop peer pairing strategy for varied skill levels
Write curriculum/udl-implementation-guide.md
acceptance_criteria: Every session includes at least 3 representation modes
Learners have choice in 2+ aspects per session
UDL principles checklist completed for all materials

description: As a curriculum developer, I want to teach farmers simplified collaboration using GitHub web UI only
tasks: Create slide deck: collaboration, forking (web UI), editing files, creating PRs, merging
Develop hands-on lab: fork farm repo, edit planting schedule, submit PR
Write quick-reference guide: Collaboration Basics
Create facilitation script; apply accessibility
acceptance_criteria: Slide deck avoids CLI — web UI only
Lab demonstrates fork → edit → PR workflow

description: As a curriculum developer, I want to teach farmers how to manage GitHub notifications and communicate with team members
tasks: Create slide deck: watching repos, notification settings, @mentions, Discussions
Develop hands-on lab: watch repo, @mention peer in issue comment, check notifications
Write quick-reference guide; create facilitation script; apply accessibility

description: As a curriculum developer, I want to teach farmers how to use issue templates, saved replies, and project templates
tasks: Create slide deck: issue templates, saved replies, project templates, repo templates
Develop hands-on lab: create equipment maintenance issue template
Write quick-reference guide; create facilitation script; apply accessibility
acceptance_criteria: Materials cover issue templates, saved replies, project templates

story_title: Develop Session 7 — Introduction to GitHub Actions
description: As a curriculum developer, I want to introduce farmers to GitHub Actions automation concepts
tasks: Create slide deck: What are Actions (farm analogy), when to automate, viewing workflow runs, YAML basics (conceptual)
Develop hands-on lab: view pre-built overdue issue reminder workflow (read-only)
Write quick-reference guide; create facilitation script; apply accessibility
acceptance_criteria: Lab is read-only exploration of existing workflow

description: As a curriculum developer, I want to teach farmers how to set up simple automated workflows
tasks: Create slide deck: automated reminders, starter workflows, customizing simple Actions
Develop hands-on lab: enable weekly equipment check reminder workflow
Write quick-reference guide; create facilitation script; apply accessibility
acceptance_criteria: Lab results in working automated workflow

description: As a curriculum developer, I want to teach advanced GitHub Projects features
tasks: Create slide deck: custom fields, iterations, roadmap view, linking to repos
Develop hands-on lab: build seasonal farm roadmap with timeline and custom fields
Write quick-reference guide; create facilitation script; apply accessibility
acceptance_criteria: Covers custom fields, iterations, roadmap view

description: As a curriculum developer, I want to introduce farmers to GitHub Copilot for AI-assisted work
tasks: Create slide deck: What is Copilot, how to enable, AI-assisted issue creation, prompting best practices
Develop hands-on lab: use Copilot to draft spring planting task issue
Write quick-reference guide; create facilitation script; apply accessibility
acceptance_criteria: Lab demonstrates practical AI assistance for farm tasks

description: As a curriculum developer, I want to introduce GitHub Spark and Agents features
tasks: Create slide deck: What is Spark, creating simple apps, GitHub Agents intro
Develop hands-on lab: use Spark to create farm weather checklist app
Write quick-reference guide; create facilitation script; apply accessibility

description: As a curriculum developer, I want learners to build a complete farm project and practice teaching peers
tasks: Create capstone project brief: complete farm management system in GitHub
Create capstone rubric aligned with Bloom's Create level
Design peer teaching exercise (5-10 min each)
Create train-the-trainer coaching outline
Write facilitation script; apply accessibility

description: As a curriculum developer, I want a ready-to-use GitHub template for farm task tracking
tasks: Create repo with README, issue templates (equipment, livestock, crops, maintenance), labels, project board
Write setup instructions at grade 8 reading level
Test by creating new repository from template
acceptance_criteria: Template contains README, issue templates, labels, project board
Template tested by creating new repo
Setup instructions written at accessible reading level

description: As a curriculum developer, I want a GitHub template for tracking planting schedules
tasks: Create repo with README, timeline project, issues with custom fields (planting date, harvest, status), sample data
Write setup instructions; test template
acceptance_criteria: Template uses timeline view with date-based custom fields
Sample data demonstrates realistic planting schedule

description: As a curriculum developer, I want a GitHub template for equipment maintenance tracking
tasks: Create repo with README, maintenance issue templates, equipment labels, photo upload guidance
Write setup instructions; test template

description: As a curriculum developer, I want a GitHub template for grant compliance tracking
tasks: Create repo with README (audit trail explanation), compliance milestone issues, deliverable project board, commit history guidance
Write setup instructions; test template
acceptance_criteria: Template demonstrates audit trail via commit history

description: As a curriculum developer, I want a plain-language glossary with farm analogies for all GitHub terms
tasks: Define 30+ terms in plain language with farm analogies
Include annotated screenshots for key terms
Format for screen reading and printing (PDF-friendly)
acceptance_criteria: Glossary includes 30+ terms with farm analogies

description: As a curriculum developer, I want a printable quick-reference for common GitHub tasks
tasks: Create 1-2 page cheat sheet covering 7+ common tasks with numbered steps and screenshots
Format as printable PDF (high contrast, large text)

description: As a curriculum developer, I want a FAQ-style guide for common GitHub problems
tasks: Document 10+ common problems with step-by-step solutions and screenshots
Format as FAQ-style document

description: As a curriculum developer, I want annotated guides showing GitHub tasks on different device types
tasks: Create annotated screenshot guides for laptop, tablet, and phone
Highlight device-specific differences and limitations
Format as 2-4 page printable guides
acceptance_criteria: Guides for laptop, tablet, and phone created

description: As a curriculum developer, I want a demo GitHub organization with sample farm repositories for live demonstrations
tasks: Create GitHub organization (e.g., github4farms-training)
Populate with sample farm repositories (task tracker, planting schedule, equipment log)
Create demo issues and projects for live demonstrations
Document setup in delivery/demo-environment-setup.md
acceptance_criteria: Demo organization created with 3+ sample repositories
Sample data is realistic farming scenarios

description: As a curriculum developer, I want training room logistics ready for in-person delivery
tasks: Test projector with slide decks (readability, contrast, font size)
Arrange seating for pair work with power outlets
Print handouts (cheat sheets, glossary, troubleshooting guide)
Set up backup mobile hotspot and test capacity
Prepare sign-in sheets, name tags, feedback forms

description: As a curriculum developer, I want Kirkpatrick evaluation instruments ready for data collection
tasks: Design L1 post-session survey (satisfaction, relevance, pacing, confidence, NPS, open feedback)
Create L2 instructor assessment rubric (per-session skill checklists)
Set up L3 tracking plan (GitHub activity at 30/60/180 days, follow-up survey)
Draft L4 interview protocol (semi-structured 20-30 min for 6-month follow-up)
Create paper + digital versions
acceptance_criteria: L1 survey in accessible format (paper + digital)

story_title: Deliver Session 1 — Introduction to GitHub & Repositories
description: Deliver the first training session in-person
tasks: Set up room (projector, seating, handouts, sign-in, backup internet)
Deliver session following facilitation script
Monitor cognitive load and pacing
Collect L1 feedback survey
Conduct L2 assessment during practice
Write delivery/session-01-debrief.md

description: Deliver Session 2 in-person
tasks: Set up room, deliver session, monitor cognitive load
Collect L1 feedback; conduct L2 assessment
Write delivery/session-02-debrief.md
acceptance_criteria: Session delivered; attendance recorded; L1/L2 data collected; debrief documented

description: Deliver Session 3 in-person
tasks: Set up room, deliver session, monitor cognitive load
Collect L1 feedback; conduct L2 assessment
Write delivery/session-03-debrief.md
acceptance_criteria: Session delivered; attendance recorded; L1/L2 data collected; debrief documented

description: Deliver Session 4 in-person
tasks: Set up room, deliver session, monitor cognitive load
Collect L1 feedback; conduct L2 assessment
Write delivery/session-04-debrief.md
acceptance_criteria: Session delivered; attendance recorded; L1/L2 data collected; debrief documented

description: Deliver 30-minute recap covering Sessions 1-4 after planting season break
tasks: Prepare 30-min recap of Sessions 1-4 key concepts
Create quick hands-on refresher exercises
Conduct Q&A on break-period GitHub usage
Assess knowledge retention informally
Write delivery/recap-post-planting-debrief.md

description: Deliver Session 5 in-person
tasks: Deliver session; collect L1/L2 data; write debrief

description: Deliver Session 6 in-person
tasks: Deliver session; collect L1/L2 data; write debrief

description: Deliver Session 7 in-person
tasks: Deliver session; collect L1/L2 data; write debrief

description: Deliver Session 8 in-person
tasks: Deliver session; collect L1/L2 data; write debrief

description: Deliver 30-minute recap covering Sessions 5-8 after harvest season break
tasks: Prepare 30-min recap of Sessions 5-8
Create refresher exercises; assess retention; write debrief
acceptance_criteria: Recap delivered; knowledge retention assessed; debrief documented

description: Deliver Session 9 in-person
tasks: Deliver session; collect L1/L2 data; write debrief

description: Deliver Session 10 in-person
tasks: Deliver session; collect L1/L2 data; write debrief

description: Deliver Session 11 in-person
tasks: Deliver session; collect L1/L2 data; write debrief

description: Deliver Session 12 with capstone project and peer teaching exercise
tasks: Deliver capstone project session
Facilitate peer teaching exercise
Identify train-the-trainer candidates
Collect L1/L2 data; write debrief with capstone completion rate and TTT notes

description: Compile and analyze L1 feedback survey data from all sessions
tasks: Distribute L1 feedback survey after each session
Compile responses into tracking spreadsheet
Analyze satisfaction and engagement trends
Document common themes (pacing, relevance, confidence, NPS)
Write evaluation/kirkpatrick-L1-report.md
acceptance_criteria: L1 data from 80%+ of learners across all sessions

description: Track hands-on skill demonstration pass rates across all sessions
tasks: Use observation checklists during each session
Track pass rates per learning objective per session
Identify struggling learners; offer additional support
Write evaluation/kirkpatrick-L2-report.md
acceptance_criteria: Pass rates per session and per objective documented

description: Monitor GitHub usage at 30, 60, 180 days post-training
tasks: Monitor GitHub activity at 30, 60, 180 days (repos, issues, projects, comments)
Distribute 60-day usage survey
Interview learners about GitHub integration into farm operations
Document usage patterns and barriers
Write evaluation/kirkpatrick-L3-report.md

description: Conduct 6-month interviews to document farm productivity improvements
tasks: Conduct 6-month follow-up interviews using protocol
Collect farm productivity improvement stories
Quantify outcomes where possible
Write 3+ case studies
Write evaluation/kirkpatrick-L4-report.md
acceptance_criteria: Case studies with farmer quotes and outcomes

story_title: Analyze Evaluation Data and Document Lessons Learned
description: Synthesize all evaluation data into actionable insights for next cohort
tasks: Synthesize L1-L4 data into insights
Identify what worked well and what to improve
Prioritize revisions (must-fix, should-fix, nice-to-have)
Write evaluation/lessons-learned.md
acceptance_criteria: Lessons learned document with data-driven insights

description: Apply lessons learned to improve materials for second cohort
tasks: Simplify complex sessions based on L1 pacing and L2 pass rate data
Add scaffolding to challenging concepts
Update farm scenarios based on learner feedback
Refresh screenshots for GitHub UI changes
Re-run accessibility audit on revised materials
Update CHANGELOG.md

description: Select high-performing learners for potential trainer role
tasks: Review L2 data for top performers (90%+ pass rates)
Assess communication and leadership skills from peer exercises
Approach candidates about interest in teaching next cohort
Write evaluation/train-the-trainer-candidates.md
acceptance_criteria: 1+ candidate identified based on performance data

description: Prepare identified candidates to co-deliver future training sessions
tasks: Provide facilitator guides and scripts to candidates
Walk through session preparation process
Conduct practice teaching session (15-30 min) with feedback
Support candidate co-delivering 1+ sessions with observation
Write evaluation/train-the-trainer-coaching-log.md
acceptance_criteria: Candidate ready to co-deliver at least 1 session
